Package danogl.util

Class ModifiableList<E>

java.lang.Object
danogl.util.ModifiableList<E>
Type Parameters:
E - The element type
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<E>
public class ModifiableList<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<E>
Represents a list that can be modified while iterated, as opposed to Java's builtin lists
Author:
Dan Nirel

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    ModifiableList​(boolean allowDuplicates)
    Creates a new modfiable list

  • Constructor Details

    • ModifiableList

      public ModifiableList​(boolean allowDuplicates)
      Creates a new modfiable list
      Parameters:
      allowDuplicates - whether the list should allow duplicate elements (elements that are "equal" according to equals)

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add​(E item)
      Add an element to the list. The element is not added immediately; it's stored in a temporary buffer whose contents is only added to the list on the next call to flushChanges().
      Returns:
      true if the element was successfully added, or false if the list does not allow duplicates and the element was already added.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(E item)
      Remove an element from the list. More specifically, it removes the first element in the list that "equals" the specified item. The element is not removed immediately; it's stored in a temporary buffer whose contents is only removed from the list on the next call to flushChanges(). If the element in question was added recently, before a call to flushChanges, the method will remove it from the buffer waiting to be added.
      Note: in order to remove all elements equal to the argument, flushChanges must be called in between calls to this method.
      Returns:
      true iff some element will indeed be removed. If the element was already removed recently, before a call to flushChanges, the method will return false and have no effect.

    • flushChanges

      public void flushChanges()
      Applies to the list the modifications made to it since the last call to this method.

    • get

      public E get​(int index)
      Returns an element in a given index.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - â€“ if the index is out of range

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the list's current size, not including changes made since the last call to flushChanges().

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(E item)
      Returns whether the list contains a given item. If the element was added after the last call to flushChanges(), the method still returns true. If the element was removed after the last call to flushChanges, the method will return false, even though it may contain duplicate elements that would still remain after the removal is applied.

    • iterator

      public java.util.Iterator<E> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<E>

    • spliterator

      public java.util.Spliterator<E> spliterator()
      Specified by:
      spliterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<E>

    • reverseOrder

      public java.lang.Iterable<E> reverseOrder()
      Returns an Iterable that iterates the list in reverse.

    • findFirst

      public E findFirst​(java.util.function.Predicate<E> predicate)
      Finds the first element in the list that matches the given predicate, or null if none is found.
